title: Runner-up at World Cup tournaments by country 1930 to 2014
summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Number of runners-up in each Country on the y axis.
The Number of runners-up is highest at Country Germany and lowest at Country France.
The difference of Number of runners-up between the highest and lowest Country is 3.0.
min_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Number of runners-up in each Country on the y axis.
The maximum Number of runners-up 4.0 is found at Country Germany and the minimum is found at France where Country is 1.0.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Number of runners-up in each Country on the y axis.
The Number of runners-up is highest at Country Germany and lowest at Country France.
The difference of Number of runners-up between the highest and lowest Country is 3.0.
max_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Number of runners-up in each Country on the y axis.
Country Germany has the highest Number of runners-up and France has the lowest Number of runners-up.
Second maximum Number of runners-up is found at Country Argentina.
The difference of Number of runners-up between the highest and lowest Country is 3.0.
The Country Germany has the highest Number of runners-up, followed by Argentina, and Argentina. Down to the Country France which is the lowest.
Country Czech Republic, Brazil, Czechoslovakia, Italy, and Hungary have a similar Number of runners-up that is 2.0.
The Country France has 1.82 times less Number of runners-up than average.
The Number of runners-up is 22.0 if we add up values of all Countrys.
